intro: Glenniea zeylanica var. fuscata, commonly known as the dark-leaved glenniea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. The varietal form fuscata is distinguished by its darker foliage compared to the typical variety.
